Other court sports have taken over the show while present-day NAVA wallows in indolence, make-believe propaganda and one-legged idealism. At the beginning of the year, NAVA came out with such a loaded calendar that one thought the game was in no way endangered in Aderinokun's ab- sence. It is unbellevable but true that only two of those listed competitions can be said to have been held at all: the Multi-corporate tourney in Jos and the Top Four affair in Lagos. This was in a sport where corporate sponsorship for competitions had almost become auto- matic before Aderinokun's ouster. When this time last year, then newly-appointed chairman of the National Sports Commission, Chief Sylvanus Oladipo Akin wunmi threw overboard the constituted authorities of the varioussports associations, some of us were only mollifled by the one- time NFA Vice-Chairman's promise to return those seen as hard-working and competent to their duty posts. Gray-haired Akin wunmi did nosuch thing. He spent five weeks reconsti- tuting the boards, during which a lot of individual - interest scheming, char- acter assassination, carpet crossing and horse trading had been given full rein. had inched to a close position behind football in followership in Nigeria. There was no doubt about it: the man knew what he was doing. He de- voted his time, money, energy and other resources to the growth of the game. He got sponsors to hold com- petitions every month, and volleyball became the rave in the country. What more, he hosted Africa and the world volleyball race within two months. In September '93, the African Cup for Women was staged in llorin with great success and in November, the Women World Cup qualifiers fea- tured host Nigeria, Egypt, Ukraine and Croatia inside the sportshall of the National Stadium. It Is also surprising that NAVA set out to organise a youth tourney when there had been no massive awareness created by the adults during the year. It is when the adults are brimming with passion and competition, that you now move in to get the youth who would have been attracted by the exploits of their senior ones on the circuit. The job is therefore made easier for the grassroot developer. I hope they will learn. The Traditional Sports Festival Scheduled for December 12 to 15 at the Indoor Sports Hall of the National Stadium will notonly be used to entertain the Nigerian populace but will be exported to other countries of the world thus creating a positive image for the country and generating the much needed foreign exchange.
